channel.title: Comments on: Super Mario Brothers on a Wall

item.title: By: Patrick
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2010/07/07/super-mario-brothers-on-a-wall/#comment-3473">Dave Holowiski</a>.
The creativity behind this was fantastic.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Dave Holowiski.

The creativity behind this was fantastic.

item.title: By: Dave Holowiski
item.dc:creator: Dave Holowiski
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2010/07/07/super-mario-brothers-on-a-wall/#comment-3471">Mo Jangda</a>.
Wow, $10,000 for a license. That's an expensive hobby!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Mo Jangda.

Wow, $10,000 for a license. That’s an expensive hobby!

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2010/07/07/super-mario-brothers-on-a-wall/#comment-3471">Mo Jangda</a>.
Wow, I wonder how long it took to put that all together.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Mo Jangda.

Wow, I wonder how long it took to put that all together.

item.title: By: Mo Jangda
item.dc:creator: Mo Jangda
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Joseph Scott.

According to the uploader:
“I stitched the entire Level together that I got a huge panorama… after this I made the animation with the original sprites from the game for the whole thing in the areas you normally won’t see…”

And someone mentioned the use of the software boujou (http://www.vicon.com/boujou/)

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2010/07/07/super-mario-brothers-on-a-wall/#comment-3469">Dave Holowiski</a>.
I'm curious to know exactly how this was done too.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Dave Holowiski.

I’m curious to know exactly how this was done too.

item.title: By: Dave Holowiski
item.dc:creator: Dave Holowiski
item.description: That's really weird, and very long. I was expecting some crazy stop motion animation but it looks like some heavy 3d compositing. It's too bad there isn't any information on how it was done.
item.content:encoded: That’s really weird, and very long. I was expecting some crazy stop motion animation but it looks like some heavy 3d compositing. It’s too bad there isn’t any information on how it was done.
